2 Y.C.G.LeeandO.R.Walsh 1 Introduction Pleuraleffusionsarecommoninclinicalrespiratorypractices and are often difficult to diagnosis or manage. Over 3000 patients per million population develop a pleural effusion each year. At least 60 pleural, pulmonary, and systemic conditions have been associated with the development of pleural effusions. Establishing the underlying cause often requires invasive procedures, from thoracentesis to percutaneous pleural biopsy and thoracoscopy—all of which carry risks[2].
